revised_title: Statistical Theory of Isotropic Turbulence and Decay
tldr: The authors develop a statistical theory of isotropic turbulence, focusing on the decay of turbulent motion. They introduce a similarity hypothesis that allows for the determination of the energy spectrum for eddies with large Reynolds numbers. The study also discusses the decay of turbulent motion caused by a mesh grating in a wind tunnel and the role of viscosity in reducing the number of degrees of freedom in turbulent systems.
